DOC.brief_summary: This study examine feasibility acceptability 6-month interprofessional community-based health promotion program , explore effect old adult ' self-management Type 2 Diabetes ( T2DM ) . Recently enrol client Diabetes Care Guelph ( DCG ) , age 65+ least two chronic condition , eligible participate . Participants must English speaking , community-dwelling , independent activity daily live , mentally competent give inform consent . The 6-month intervention consist : in-home visit Registered Nurse Registered Dietitian DCG ; participation monthly Diabetes Wellness Day group program offer Guelph Wellington Seniors Association ( GWSA ) together DCG ; peer support train volunteer Diabetes Wellness Day group program ; care coordination DCG Registered Nurse help participant access necessary support service ; monthly team conference care provider DCG GWSA develop client-centred plan care . To evaluate program , participant complete interviewer-administered questionnaire intervention , care provider peer volunteer take part group interview .
DOC.brief_title: Interprofessional Community-Based Diabetes Intervention Older Adults
DOC.criteria: Age 65+ Referred Diabetes Care Guelph within past 12 month At least two chronic condition addition Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus English speak Communitydwelling , city Guelph Independent activity daily live Mentally competent provide inform consent
